definition: extensive but not refined (idiom); to know something about everything/jack-of-all-trades, master of none
old variant of 博[bo2]
extensive/ample/rich/obtain/aim/to win/to get/plentiful/to gamble
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
(negative prefix)/not/no
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)

sentences.english: Don't be a jack of all trades. Be the master of a few.
sentences.chinese: 不做博而不精的人，只掌握几种技能。

sentences.english: They have a broad, but not always thorough, knowledge of their company's operations.
sentences.chinese: 在公司运作方面，他们的知识博而不精。

definition: to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)
lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
see 半瓶醋[ban4 ping2 cu4]
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
to know that it is so but not why it is so (idiom)
pinyin: zhi1 qi2 ran2 er2 bu4 zhi1 qi2 suo3 yi3 ran2
related.word: 知其然而不知其所以然

definition: stupid/slow on the uptake
to skim (through a book)/to read cursorily/to dip into
dissenting religious sect (idiom); heretical school of opinion/dissident group
to have accomplished nothing (idiom)
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
abstruse/complicated
to try to draw a tiger but end up with a likeness of a dog (idiom)/to try to do sth overambitious and end up botching it
shallow study/superficial/scant knowledge
all-rounder/versatile
superficial
